title: Shearer unsure 'awful' Arsenal will survive as Arteta admits 'other teams want it more'
description: Former England captain Alan Shearer says he would "not be so sure" about Arsenal surviving in the Premier League at the end of the season.

title: Seven goals in a game again - but this time Liverpool show form of champions
description: When Liverpool lost 7-2 to Aston Villa in October, their title credentials were questioned - but few doubts remain as they score seven themselves at Crystal Palace.

title: Coronavirus: Trump's Covid vaccine chief admits delivery mistake
description: The army general apologises to states who will get fewer Pfizer doses than they were expecting.

title: Brexit: No trade deal unless 'substantial shift' from EU, UK says
description: With a decision expected before Christmas, UK sources say it is increasingly likely there will be no deal.

title: 'I won't have next summer, let alone next Christmas'
description: Three people tell BBC News how the new Christmas coronavirus rules will affect them.

title: Strictly Come Dancing: 7 memorable moments from this series
description: Bill Bailey, HRVY, Maisie Smith and Jamie Laing will compete for the glitterball trophy on Saturday.

title: Strictly Come Dancing: Bill Bailey crowned 2020 winner
description: Bill Bailey, Maisie Smith, HRVY and Jamie Laing competed to lift the glitterball trophy.

title: Covid Christmas: What can you do to stay safe?
description: For those who can meet up on Christmas Day, what can be done to reduce the spread of coronavirus?

title: Covid: Cabinet holding talks amid rising infection rates in England
description: There is "concern" about new data for parts of England and the cabinet is summoned for a lunchtime call.

title: Covid-19: Explosion kills nine coronavirus patients in Turkey
description: Nine people are killed as an oxygen ventilator explodes at a coronavirus ward of a private hospital.

title: Epstein ex-associate Jean-Luc Brunel placed under formal investigation
description: Modelling agent Jean-Luc Brunel is accused of rape and sexual harassment by French authorities.

title: Brexit: UK-EU trade talks enter critical 48-hour period
description: The EU says the "moment of truth" has arrived as disagreements with the UK over fishing rights continue.

title: Caliphate: NY Times loses awards for Islamic State podcast over false reporting
description: The paper admits its blockbuster podcast about Islamic State group failed to meet editorial standards.

title: Golovkin dominates Szeremeta to make record 21st title defence
description: Gennady Golovkin knocks down Kamil Szeremeta four times en route to a record 21st defence of his IBF world middleweight title.

title: Sports Personality of the Year: Ronnie O'Sullivan on winning sixth world title
description: Speaking in August, Sports Personality of the Year contender Ronnie O'Sullivan says his dreams have become a reality after winning his sixth world snooker title.

title: India bowled out for 36 as Australia win first Test by eight wickets
description: India are bowled out for 36 - their lowest total in Test cricket - as Australia win the first Test in Adelaide by eight wickets.

title: Dortmund's Moukoko becomes Bundesliga's youngest scorer, aged 16
description: Borussia Dortmund's Youssoufa Moukoko becomes the youngest player to score in the Bundesliga in his side's 2-1 loss to Union Berlin.

title: Dionne Warwick: How 'Auntie' tweeted herself to newfound fame in 2020
description: Turns out, having a career that spans decades and being hilarious are not mutually exclusive.

title: 737 Max: Boeing 'inappropriately coached' pilots in test after crashes
description: US Senate investigators find problems with tests conducted in the wake of two deadly crashes.

title: The Papers: 'Lockdown 3 fear' and Oxford jab 'before new year'
description: Many of Saturday's papers lead with the prospect the UK could enter national restrictions post-Christmas.

title: Covid: Italy latest European country to order Christmas lockdown
description: Non-essential shops will be closed with travel only allowed for work, health and emergency reasons.

title: Covid at Christmas: 'Chris Whitty is more popular than Britney Spears'
description: England's chief medical officer and his deputy Jonathan Van-Tam prove popular with shoppers.

title: Sir David Attenborough on Joe Biden, Christmas wrapping... and flamingos
description: Sir David examines how wildlife adapts to the forces of nature, such as volcanoes, in a new series.

title: Vanessa Bryant, her mother's lawsuit and the value of childcare
description: Vanessa Bryant's messy legal dispute with her mother has also got us talking about the value of housework.

title: Met Police officer sues over 'sexual and racist' texts
description: The ex-officer is suing her former colleague after he used racist and sexual language in his messages.

title: Covid-19: Fake 'immunity booster' found on sale in London shops
description: Tests carried out for the BBC show herbal remedy Coronil offers no protection from coronavirus.

title: Covid: Postie helps those shielding on her round
description: Lucy Garlick's been shopping for people shielding and leaving chocolate for children.

title: The 'ghost' silhouettes popping up in a Scottish Borders village
description: Residents of West Linton have seen all kinds of creatures appear since the Covid pandemic began.

title: Week in pictures: 12-18 December 2020
description: A selection of some of the most powerful images taken around the world this week.

title: Covid: The countries worried they won't get the vaccine
description: Countries such as Zimbabwe, Mexico and Pakistan are likely to have to wait for the coronavirus vaccine.

title: Faith and fertility at Bethlehem's Milk Grotto
description: Some say the place where Mary is said to have nursed Jesus holds the power to help couples conceive.

title: Microplastics, drugs and food - how jellyfish can help us
description: Jellyfish are being used to develop new medicines, filters for microplastics and for food.

title: Long Covid: I used to run, now I can walk 200 metres
description: Dr Nathalie MacDermott, 38, explains how Covid-19 has affected her life.

title: North Korea: Potato propaganda is back... but what does it mean?

description: Blindian Project runs workshops to prepare couples for tricky family introductions.
